messages.message:
Hi team,
I'll be pushing a change to our SaaS infra modules to deploy changes related to secret management. Once this is merged I'll be updating the multi-tenant *hosts*.
While we're not expecting this to cause any downtime in existing deployments, I'm sharing this announcement in case you notice any hiccups in the deployment pipelines while updating tenants.

Quick update here - all hosts are have been updated successfully :dancing-penguin:
Please check out this wiki (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/2147221523/External+Secrets+Management+in+SaaS) to learn more about how we use External Secrets Operator to centrally manage OpenAI secrets and keep them in sync with the kubernetes secrets in our SaaS deployments.
Quick note - any existing environments will continue using their dedicated secrets if these have been configured in ICC, but *only until the environment is updated.* By default, existing and new deployments will be moved to use the centrally managed OpenAI keys, unless the deployment owner follows the tenant specific secret (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/2147221523/External+Secrets+Management+in+SaaS#Tenant-specific-secrets-in-SaaS-(including-sandboxes)) steps.
